raw_text:
Elvis set to top UK singles chart
 
 Rock 'n' roll legend Elvis is set to top the UK singles chart on Sunday, 27 years after his death.
 
 The re-release of hit song Jailhouse Rock was out-selling X Factor winner Steve Brockstein's cover of Against All Odds by 2,000 copies on Tuesday. If the record does make the top spot, it will be Elvis' 19th UK number one. The last time he topped the charts was with the remix of the little-known song A Little Less Conversation, which was number one in June 2002. If Jailhouse Rock does reach number one on Sunday, it will be the 999th in the history of the UK pop charts. The song first topped the charts in 1958. Chart analysts say Elvis could score the 1000th number one as well. His record One Night will be released the following week, followed the week after by A Fool Such As I, as part of his record company SonyBMG's new Elvis campaign. It has called it "the most ambitious singles release campaign in the history of the UK record industry".

This could make it the 999th chart-topper in history if the song remains at number one on Sunday. A new campaign featuring Elvis songs will release throughout the following weeks.

<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Elvis Presley and his chart successes. Let me read through the user's query carefully.

The user provided a chunk of text that includes information about Elvis's last success on the UK charts, which was "A Little Less Conversation" in 2002. Now he's setting it top again in 2023, achieving his 19th spot there. He also mentions the record by jailhouse rock, "Jailhouse Rock," sold 2000 copies more than a X Factor song by Steve Brockstein. 

So I need to capture all these key points: Elvis's new chart success, the new record, its sales numbers, his previous chart appearances, and what the record company is calling it ambitious.

I should structure the summary clearly without explanations or formatting, just plain text. I'll make sure to include all main ideas and details like the year 2023, the chart position, sales figure, and any notable events around it.
</think>

Elvis Presley will settop UK singles chart in 2023 after being number one since June 2002, marking his 19th spot on the charts. "Jailhouse Rock" sold 2000 copies more than a Steve Brockstein cover of "Against All Odds." Elvis plans to release new singles "One Night," "A Fool Such As I," and "A Fool Such As I II," under SonyBMG's 'Most Ambitious...' campaign, followed by the album.
tinyllama:1.1b: Elvis will be back on the UK top singles chart, with a re-release of his hit song Jailhouse Rock outselling the X Factor winner Steve Brocksteiin's cover by 2,000 copies. If Elvis' latest effort reaches number one in the coming weeks, it will make him the first ever musician to score a total of 19 UK number ones, with the last time he topped the charts being with the remix of A Litttle Less Conversation in June 2002. If Jailhouse Rock reaches the top spot, it would be Elvis' 999th chart-topping single and his biggest since his 1958 number one hit. His new record One Night will also be relased a week after that, followed by A Foo, as part of SonyBMG's new Elvis campaign. It has called it "the most ambitious singles release campaign in the history of the UK record industry."
tinydolphin:1.1b: The statement provided above discusses the re-release of a classic rock 'n' roll song, Jailhouse Rock by Steve Brockstein, which has achieved a new sales record on the UK singles chart. It is set to become Elvis Presley's 19th number one hit, if it does surpass X Factor winner Steve Brockstein's cover of Against All Odds. The re-release was released on Tuesday, and if Jailhouse Rock does make it to the top spot, it will become Elvis' 19th number one hit, breaking a record he previously held in June 2002 with the remix of the little-known song A Little Less Conversation.

stablelm2:1.6b: Elvis is expected to become the 14th number one artist on the UK singles chart with the re-release of his hit song, Jailhouse Rock, which outsold Steve Brockstein's cover of Against All Odds by 2 copies. This would make it the 14th time Elvis reached number one in the UK, tying the record set in 1978. If Jailhouse Rock reaches number one on Sunday, it will be the 14th time this has happened in UK history and could even break the record for 100th number one artist.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Elvis Presley is poised to reclaim the UK singles chart's top spot on Sunday, 27 years post-death, with his song Jailhouse Rock. This marks Elvis' potential 19th UK number one and the 999th overall in pop history, last achieved in June 2002. If successful, it could also signify Elvis' 1000th chart hit. SonyBMG's new campaign, including his records One Night and A Fool Such As I, aims to make this the most extensive singles release in UK record industry history.
